docs.title: Beneficiary
docs.text: These are individuals (adults) who are seeking earning opportunities from the YH platform.

docs.title: Referral Job
docs.text: These are jobs posted by Referral partners. Seekers will be redirected to the Partner website for application submission.

docs.title: Referral Partner
docs.text: These are organisations that upload available jobs and ask Seekers to apply on their website.

docs.title: Pathway Activity:
docs.text:
These are individual activities that a Beneficiary can do.

The different types of activities are:

  • earning,
  • skilling,
  • forms,
  • artefacts.

A pathway activity can belong to one or more Pathways.

docs.title: Pathway:
docs.text: This is a list of activities that define a pathway.

docs.title: Pathway Creator
docs.text: The role that will be allowed to do the steps as outlined below.

docs.title: Earning Activity
docs.text: These are a specific earning opportunity link or a link that lists a number of earning opportunities.

docs.title: Skills Activity
docs.text: This is a specific skills opportunity link from a Skills partner Organisation (incl P2E)

docs.title: Pathway Creation
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    actor A as Pathway Creator
    participant P as Platform
    actor B as Beneficiary
    actor S as Skills Orgn

    A->>P: 1. Create Pathway Activity
    A->>P: 2. Define a Pathway
    A->>P: 3. Allocate Users to a Pathway
    B->>P: 4. Register Pathways
    B->>P: 5. List available Pathways
    B->>P: 6. Add a Pathway
    B->>P: 7. List Joined Pathways
    B->>P: 8. Go thru a Pathway
    S->>P: 9. Update a Pathway
    B->>P: 10. Complete or Close a Pathway
    A->>P: 11. Remove a Pathway

docs.title: Step 1: Pathway Activity Creation
docs.text:
Check the Pathway Activity Data Structure

Rules/Features missing

docs.title: Step 2: Pathway Definition
docs.text:
Check the Pathway Data Structure

Rules/Features

  • Search Pathway Activities (criteria?)
  • Copy existing Pathway as a template to add/subtract activities
  • Publishing makes the Pathway available for next step
  • If a user is undergoing a Pathway it cannot be edited.
  • A Published Pathway can be marked as deleted (even if a user is undergoing)
  • A deleted Pathway is no longer available to a Beneficiary.

Need clarification on

  • Criteria for search of Pathway Activities
  • Activity Type Links

docs.title: Step 3: Allocate Users to Pathway
docs.text:
Check Pathway Beneficiary Search Form¶

Rules/Features

None defined so far

docs.title: Step 4: Beneficiary Registration
docs.text:
Rules/Features

  1. Beneficiary will need to register once when some fields will be mandatory to proceeed.
  2. Check min-set fields required for Pathways registration

docs.title: Step 5: List Available Pathways
docs.text:
Check the fields of the view

Rules/Features

  1. Only Pathways allocated to the Beneficiary is listed here.

Should this list be filterable/ sortable?

docs.title: Step 6: Add a Pathway
docs.text:
Rules/Features

  1. From the Step 5 list of available pathways, on selection, the Pathway activities are visible. Check Pathway Details View structure

  2. On confirmation, the pathway is added to the Beneficiary Joined Pathways List.

docs.title: Step 7: List Joined Pathways
docs.text:
Check View Structure

Rules/Features

  1. A pathway can be selected and a priority set (Check Priority enums)
  2. Pathways on the list are sorted on priority.
  3. On selection of a Pathway, that row becomes the top-most row. (Does this mean that it becomes priority A?)
  4. Closed Pathways are at the bottom

docs.title: Step 8: Go through a Pathway
docs.text:
Rules/Features

  1. The first time the Beneficiary opens an added Pathway, the system should confirm and record start of the pathway.
  2. Check the Pathway Joined Detailed View
  3. No more than 3 pathways can be "current" at any time.
  4. In the above view, the user can pick the current activity (if in progress) or the next availability depending on the is_order boolean.
  5. The following are the rules on completion:
    1. earning type: clicking on link will make it as "done".
    2. skills-w-feedback type: click on link will make status as "in progress". This will auto update when skills organisation updates data
    3. skills-w/o-feedback type: click on link will make status as "in progress". Beneficiary will manually update when activity is completed.
    4. artefacts type: when user clicks on link, the activity status is marked as "done"
    5. forms type: when user clicks on link, the activity status is marked as "done"

Shareable activity across Pathways needs to be discussed

docs.title: Step 9: Update of a Pathway
docs.text:
Rules/Features

  1. When Beneficiary clicks on a Skills link that is from an Organisation that provides the platform feedback, this step updates the completion status of the activity.

Would anyone else be updating Activity Status?

docs.title: Step 10: Complete or Close a Pathway
docs.text:
Rules/Features

  1. If all activities are done, the Pathway will automatically get closed.
  2. The Beneficiary can close any Pathway at any time.

Can a closed Pathway be re-opened?
